tuv.seg: Each judge in Ireland has a personal assistant in court called a "tipstaff"
Tá cúntóir pearsanta ag gach breitheamh, a gcuirtear "giolla cúirte" air

He or she wears a black gown and when he or she is in court, he or she usually sits on a chair at one side of the judge. One of his/her duties is to announce the arrival and departure of the judge from the courtroom
Caitheann sé nó sí róba dubh agus nuair atá sé nó sí sa chúirt, suíonn sé nó sí ar chathaoir ar thaobh amháin den bhreitheamh
The tipstaff's main function is to provide general assistance to the judge:
Is í príomhfheidhm an ghiolla cúirte cúnamh ginearálta a chur ar fáil don bhreitheamh:
• The tipstaff accompanies the judge while the judge is carrying out his or her duties
• Téann an giolla cúirte in aice leis an mbreitheamh nuair atá a chuid dualgas á gcomhlíonadh ag an mbreitheamh
In the High Court and the Supreme Court, the tipstaff holds a long wooden staff when he or she is bringing the judge from chambers to the court and back
San Ard Chúirt agus sa Chúirt Uachtarach, tá bachall fhada adhmaid idir lámha ag an ngiolla cúirte agus é ag tabhairt an breitheamh óna chuid seomraí go dtí an chúirt agus ar ais
• The tipstaff communicates with the other tipstaffs to keep the judge informed about what is happening in other courts on a day-to-day basis
• Bíonn an giolla cúirte i dteagmháil le giollaí cúirte eile le gur féidir leis an breitheamh a chur ar an eolas faoi céard atá ag tarlú sna cúirteanna eile go laethúil
• If the judge wishes to communicate a message to another court, needs a book or needs another errand to be carried out, he or she may ask his or her tipstaff for assistance
• Má theastaíonn ón mbreitheamh teachtaireracht a thabhairt do chúirt eile, nó má tá leabhar uaidh nó má theastaíonn aon rud eile uaidh is féidir leis nó léi cúnamh a fháil ón ngiolla cúirte
